Record.ClassificationPath: Bacterial Infections and Mycoses/Bacterial Infections/Gram-Negative Bacterial Infections/Helicobacter Infections
Record.Description: Infections with organisms of the genus HELICOBACTER, particularly, in humans, HELICOBACTER PYLORI. The clinical manifestations are focused in the stomach, usually the gastric mucosa and antrum, and the upper duodenum. This infection plays a major role in the pathogenesis of type B gastritis and peptic ulcer disease.
